verses.plain: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.

tokens.t: A
name
rather to be chosen than great riches,
loving favour rather than silver and gold.

verses.plain: The rich and poor meet together: the LORD is the maker of them all.

tokens.t: The rich and poor meet together: the
the maker of them all.

verses.plain: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.

tokens.t: A prudent
foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.

verses.plain: By humility and the fear of the LORD are riches, and honour, and life.

tokens.t: By humility
the fear of the
riches, and honour, and life.

verses.plain: Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.

tokens.t: Thorns
snares
in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.

verses.plain: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.

tokens.t: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.

verses.plain: The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.

tokens.t: The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower
servant to the lender.

verses.plain: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.

tokens.t: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.

verses.plain: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.

tokens.t: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.

verses.plain: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.

tokens.t: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.

verses.plain: He that loveth pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.

tokens.t: He that loveth pureness of heart,
the grace of his lips the king
his friend.

verses.plain: The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.

tokens.t: The eyes of the
preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.

verses.plain: The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.

tokens.t: The slothful
saith,
a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.

verses.plain: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein.

tokens.t: The mouth of strange women
a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the
shall fall therein.

verses.plain: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

tokens.t: Foolishness
bound in the heart of a child;
the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

verses.plain: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.

tokens.t: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his
he that giveth to the rich,
surely
to want.

verses.plain: Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.

tokens.t: Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.

verses.plain: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.

tokens.t: For
a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.

verses.plain: That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.

tokens.t: That thy trust may be in the
, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.

verses.plain: Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,

tokens.t: Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,

verses.plain: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?

tokens.t: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?

verses.plain: Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:

tokens.t: Rob not the poor, because he
poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:

verses.plain: For the LORD will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.

tokens.t: For the
will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.

verses.plain: Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:

tokens.t: Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:

verses.plain: Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.

tokens.t: Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.

verses.plain: Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.

tokens.t: Be not thou
of them that strike hands,
of them that are sureties for debts.

verses.plain: If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?

tokens.t: If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?

verses.plain: Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.

tokens.t: Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.

verses.plain: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.

tokens.t: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean

footnotes.text: loving…: or, favour is better than, etc
By…: or, The reward of humility, etc
the lender: Heb. the man that lendeth
the rod…: or, with the rod of his anger he shall be consumed
He that…: Heb. Good of eye
for…: or, and hath grace in his lips
to them…: or, to those that send thee?
